column5: LONDON Ben Ainslie  hailed as Britain's most celebrated sailor since Admiral Lord Nelson after helping Oracle Team USA to America's Cup victory  wants to win the 'Auld Mug' for his countrymen next time around.

column4: New Zealand shrugs off America's Cup loss
column5: WELLINGTON New Zealand Prime Minister John Key summed up the feelings of his country when their America's Cup team were beaten by Oracle Team USA in the winner-take-all showdown in San Francisco on Thursday.

column4: Capping an epic comeback  Oracle wins the America's Cup
column5: SAN FRANCISCO Oracle Team USA prevailed in a dramatic winner-take-all showdown with Emirates Team New Zealand on Wednesday to win the 34th America's Cup  completing a stirring comeback that helped make the once-troubled event among the most exciting in sailing history.

column4: Exclusive: Petrobras  IBV wells show major new oil find in Brazil
column5: RIO DE JANEIRO A drilling campaign off Brazil's northeastern coast shows that an area controlled by Petrobras and an Indian partner likely holds more than a billion barrels of oil  government and industry officials told Reuters  bolstering hopes that the region will soon become the country's biggest new oil frontier.

column4: Brazil union says Petrobras fails to address demands
column5: BRASILIA Brazil's national oil workers federation (FUP) said on Wednesday that state-run oil company Petroleo Brasileira SA  had presented it with an offer one month into contract negotiations that did not address its wage demands.

column4: Guinea braces for long-delayed parliamentary vote
column5: CONAKRY  Sept 26 Parliamentary elections in Guinea on Saturday officially cap the mineral-rich West African country's return to civilian rule after a 2008 coup  but many fear that the vote could reignite violence that killed dozens of people earlier this year.

column5: PARIS French drugmaker Sanofi has started construction of a new 70 million-euro ($95 million) plant in Algeria that will be its largest industrial site in Africa  the company said on Thursday.

column4: Christie's sells $25 mln of goods in its first China auction
column5: SHANGHAI  Sept 26 Christie's sold $25 million worth of art  jewellery  watches and wine on Thursday at its first auction in China  as it became the latest international auction house to operate on the mainland.

column4: UPDATE 3-Statoil plans more Canada exploration after big find
column5: OSLO  Sept 26 Norway's Statoil ASA has made its biggest oil discovery beyond Norway in the seas off Canada's East Coast and said the region could become a major oil producer after 2020.

column4: Statoil's Canadian oil find could hold 600 mln barrels
column5: OSLO  Sept 26 Statoil's Bay du Nord oil discovery offshore Canada  first announced in August  could contain between 300 million and 600 million barrels of recoverable oil  the state-owned Norwegian firm said on Thursday.

column4: Pilots fall asleep on long-haul flight to UK: paper

column5: MILAN  Sept 26 Shares in Telecom Italia  fell more than 2 percent before turning positive in morning trade on Thursday on uncertainty over the debt-laden company's strategy following a deal earlier in the week to give Telefonica gradual control of its Italian rival.

column4: U.S. money funds diversify in Puerto Rico  sidestep credit risk
column5: BOSTON  Sept 26 Some U.S. municipal money market funds appear to have loaded up on bonds issued by Puerto Rico  whose free-spending ways and chronic deficits have scared off many investors in recent weeks.

column4: Exxon  Shell may bid in Sri Lanka oil  gas block auction - govt
column5: NEW DELHI  Sept 26 Oil majors Exxon Mobil Corp   Royal Dutch Shell Plc and France's Total  have shown interest in bidding for blocks offered in Sri Lanka's current licensing round  the island nation's upstream regulator said on Thursday.

column4: Toyota recalls about 694 000 Sienna minivans in North America

column5: HOUSTON  Sept 26 Valero Energy Corp  the largest U.S. refiner  plans to increase light crude oil processing capacity at several U.S. Gulf Coast refineries through 2018  the company said in an investor presentation.

column4: Valero to raise light crude capacity at US Gulf refineries
column5: HOUSTON  Sept 26 Valero Energy Corp aims to increase light crude oil processing capacity at several U.S. Gulf Coast refineries through 2018  the company said in an investor presentation.

column4: M&A flat so far this year  even with mammoth Verizon deal
column5: NEW YORK Dealmaking around the world was basically flat over the first nine months of the year  a disappointing level given the $130 billion Verizon Communications Inc  transaction that bolstered mergers and acquisition volumes in the third quarter.
